caption:
This image is a close-up portrait of an elderly man viewed from the side. The man has a serious expression on his face and is partially bald with the remaining hair closely trimmed. His facial features are well-defined, with prominent cheeks, a strong nose, and deep-set, thoughtful eyes. He is dressed in a dark black or navy blazer.

The background features blurry green foliage, providing a natural and somewhat muted backdrop that contrasts with the subject, emphasizing his features. The lighting appears to be natural, with a soft illumination on his face that highlights its contours against the darker, less defined background. The overall mood conveyed by the photograph is introspective and serene.
title: Concerned about trident board member george lhamon vice-president of international finance, for pacific car corporation Seattle, attends a board meeting at a house in Kitsap County, at Bainbridge island, near Seattle, Washington.  The group is concerned that the navy adheres to all applicable laws as the trident submarine base is built nearby.  Some 27,000 new residents are projected for the area when the naval installation is completed
